newsitem.title: USA: S. Dakota corn harvest advances, soy winding down.
newsitem.headline: S. Dakota corn harvest advances, soy winding down.

text.p: The corn harvest in South Dakota advanced into full swing while the soybean harvest was winding down after making excellent progress during the week ended October 27, South Dakota's Agricultural Statistics Service said in a weekly report.

High moisture content of corn was delaying harvest in many fields. Corn was 37 percent harvested versus 19 percent last week, 50 percent last year and 47 percent for the five-year average. Corn was rated two percent poor, 10 percent fair, 58 percent good and 30 percent excellent.
Ninety-five percent of soybeans were harvested versus 84 percent a week earlier, 81 percent a year ago and 86 percent on average.
Winter wheat was 84 percent emerged, ahead of 81 percent last week but behind 91 percent last year and 96 on average.
Seventy-eight percent of sorghum was harvested compared with 56 percent last week, 70 percent last year and 65 percent average.
Eighty five percent of sunflowers were harvested versus 57 last week, 69 percent last year and 72 percent on average.
Topsoil soil moisture rated nil very short, two percent short, 88 percent adequate and 10 percent surplus.
